data.title: Best attractions in College Corner
data.meta_description: Find the best attractions in your cities. Discover the famous attractions posted by cityseeker professionals near you.
data.text:
Overlooking Acton Lake, Hueston Woods State Park is surrounded by dense forests and pastures. This 2,936-acres (1,188 hectares) wooded park was established in 1957. This park was formerly used to house a prison. A very popular activity offered by this park is fossil hunting. You will find a variety of ancient fossils like horn corals, crinoids, mollusks, and more. Some of the other activities offered here are hiking, fishing, camping, swimming, and golfing. With its diverse landscapes and range of activities, Hueston Woods State Park is a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts, families, and those seeking a peaceful retreat in Ohio.

The Hueston Woods Nature Center, located in Hueston Woods State Park, serves as an educational and interactive hub for visitors of all ages. The center features a variety of exhibits that highlight the park's diverse ecosystems, native wildlife, and geological history. Interactive displays, live animal exhibits, and hands-on activities engage visitors and provide a deeper understanding of the natural world. Knowledgeable staff and naturalists are available to lead guided hikes, nature programs, and wildlife observation sessions. The nature center also offers stunning views of the surrounding woodlands and provides valuable information about the parkâ€™s extensive network of hiking trails and recreational activities. The Hueston Woods Nature Center is a must-visit for those looking to enrich their outdoor experience.

Acton Lake, nestled within Hueston Woods State Park, spans 625 acres (253 hectares) and offers a serene escape for outdoor enthusiasts. This picturesque lake is perfect for a variety of water activities, including boating, fishing, and kayaking. Anglers will find abundant populations of bass, crappie, and bluegill, making it a popular fishing destination year-round. The park features several boat ramps, a marina, and boat rentals for visitors' convenience. Surrounding the lake, visitors can explore miles of hiking and biking trails that wind through lush forests and offer stunning views of the water. Picnic areas and campgrounds are available for those looking to extend their stay. Acton Lake promises a tranquil and enjoyable outdoor experience for all.

One of the oldest buildings in the neighborhood, William H. McGuffey House takes you back in time to a more charming era in the city's history. The red brick structure finds itself listed on the National Register of Historic Places and is a prime historical and cultural landmark. Housing the William Holmes McGuffey Museum, the building documents the lifestyle and culture of the early 19th century.

Goggin Ice Arena situated on the campus of the Miami University is home to the Miami Red Hawks, the university's ice hockey team. Apart from ice hockey matches, this arena also plays host to synchronized and figure skating events on intramural and varsity levels. Goggin Ice Arena features two rinks, namely Pad A and Pad B. The Pad A is used for all the main events meanwhile Pad B is used for recreational skating and other activities. Since its opening in 2006, this arena has provided the aspiring athletes of the university with a state-of-the-art facility. Skating classes and workshops are also offered here by expert trainers for people of all ages.
